results.sentence: The Handreichung is a translation of the original document.
DeepL is a translation tool.
DeepL is excellent at translating.
DeepL is not 100% correct.
DeepL is not 100% correct in a legal sense.
The Handreichung is for students.
Students have the right to inspect exam documents.
Students can inspect exam documents after taking an exam.
Students can inspect exam documents to see their performance evaluation.
Students have obligations when asserting their right to inspect exam documents.
The inspection provides students with information about knowledge gaps.
The inspection makes the examination assessment comprehensible.
The inspection critically examines the assessment.
The inspection allows students to raise objections against the assessment.
The inspection concerns all examination formats.
The inspection focuses on written examinations.
The inspection focuses on the assessment of written examinations.
The inspection makes up the largest part of the process.
The largest part of the inspection concerns written examinations.
Every student has the right to inspect their own examinations.
Every student has the right to inspect their own evaluations.
Students have the right to inspect independent parts of an examination.
Students have the right to inspect subsequent modules.
Students have the right to inspect grades mentioned in subsequent modules.
Certificates are formed from the inspection.
The inspection takes place after the examination procedure.
The inspection takes place after the performance has been determined and announced.
The inspection takes place before a repeat examination.
The inspection takes place with sufficient advance notice before an oral supplementary examination.
The right to inspection exists if the student has a legitimate interest in inspection.
A legitimate interest in inspection exists if the findings can be used to claim a reconsideration.
There is no entitlement to inspection.
The examination was graded 1.0.
There is no need for legal protection.
The right of inspection includes examiner's notes.
Examiners must refer to notes in the vote.
The right of inspection includes expert opinions.
The right of inspection includes minutes of the evaluation.
The right of inspection includes statements.
The right of inspection includes possible counter-opinions.
The right of inspection does not include notes.
The right of inspection does not include sketches.
The right of inspection does not include recordings.
The right of inspection does not include solution notes.
The right of inspection does not include evaluation schemes.
Examiners prepare evaluation schemes in advance.
Examiners prepare solution notes in advance.
Examiners prepare recordings in advance.
Examiners prepare sketches in advance.
Examiners prepare notes in advance.
There is no right to inspect sample solutions.
Examiners may refer to documents beforehand.
Examiners refer to documents in their notes.
It is not possible to inspect examination files.
Examination files are not available for inspection.
Examination files are not accessible for inspection.
Examination files are not inspectable.
Examination files of other examinees are not inspectable.
Examination files of other examinees are not accessible for inspection.
Examination files of other examinees are not available for inspection.
Examination files are not inspectable for other examinees.
Examination files are not accessible for other examinees.
Examination files are not available for other examinees.
Examination files are not inspectable by other examinees.
Examination files are not accessible by other examinees.
Examination files are not available by other examinees.
Examination files are not inspectable for the purpose of referring to the evaluation.
Examination files are not accessible for the purpose of referring to the evaluation.
Examination files are not available for the purpose of referring to the evaluation.
Students should contact the examiner after learning of the examination result.
Students can request inspection informally.
Students can request inspection by email or telephone.
Students must send the inspection request directly to the DISC for distance learning programs.
Inspection should be made possible promptly after the announcement of the evaluation.
The oral examination evaluation process has a one-week deadline for objections.
Candidates must state unfair assessment within one week.
Candidates must state inability to understand the assessment within one week.
Candidates can raise objections to the assessment.
The inspection takes place on the TU Kaiserslautern premises.
The inspection takes place during the university's office hours.
Departments are free to organize the inspection collectively.
Students must inform themselves about the inspection organization.
Students must be given sufficient time for the inspection.
The inspection duration depends on the examination scope.
Students can inform themselves about the examination content.
Students who stay abroad are unable to attend the regular appointments.
Students with a verifiable illness are unable to attend the regular appointments.
Students must be offered an additional appointment upon informal request.
Students must be allowed to make copies.
Students must be allowed to make photocopies at their own expense.
Students may make their own notes during the inspection.
Students may make a photocopy in the form of photographs.
Departments decide whether copies are sent by post.
Students have no obligation to receive a copy during the inspection.
Students have the opportunity to receive a copy from the teaching area.
Students have no right to electronic transmission of the copy.
Departments decide whether to send the copy electronically.
Electronic transmission of the copy must be secure.
Secure electronic transmission includes signed and encrypted e-mail.
Secure electronic transmission includes download from an access-secured server.
Sending to the RHRK account is a secure way to transmit the copy.
Students bear the costs of making the copies.
Students bear the costs of making copies.
Students are charged based on the TU's scale of charges.
Students are charged separately by invoice.
Students use photocopies to check the assessment.
Examinations are protected by copyright.
Reports are protected by copyright.
Minutes are protected by copyright.
Questions are protected by copyright.
Comments are protected by copyright.
Dissemination of copyrighted materials is not permitted.
Public reproduction of copyrighted materials is not permitted.
Use of copyrighted materials is not permitted.
Disclosure of copyrighted materials to third parties is not permitted.
Violations of copyright can have civil consequences.
Violations of copyright can have criminal consequences.
Examiners do not supervise the inspection themselves.
Examiners do not accompany the inspection themselves.
Examiners appoint competent staff members for the inspection.
Staff members provide initial expert information.
Students can be represented in the inspection procedure.
Students can be represented in case of hospitalization.
Students can be represented in case of a stay abroad.
Authorized attorneys can represent students in the inspection procedure.
The authorization includes filing the application.
The authorization includes receiving a copy.
The authorization does not include discussing the examination.
The discussion of the examination is a personal matter.
Authorized attorneys are exempt from this rule.
Authorized representatives must identify themselves at the appointment.
Authorized representatives must present a power of attorney.
The original grade should not be changed to the student's disadvantage.
Students can approach the department/examiner for reconsideration.
Students can approach DISC for reconsideration.
The student must state objections to the evaluation.
Objections to the evaluation must be substantiated.
Objections must be substantiated in a concrete manner.
Objections must be substantiated in a comprehensible manner.
The misjudgement of the examiner must be clear.
A general reference to other students' evaluations is not sufficient.
Students are informed of the examination result in a notice.
The time limit for appeal is one month.
The time limit starts from the date of notification.
No extension of the time limit occurs by inspection.
No extension of the time limit occurs by independent request for reconsideration.
An objection can be filed within the time limit.
The reconsideration procedure can be continued within the time limit.
Students can discuss objections with the examiner.
Students can have justified doubts about the examiner's decision.
An appeal can be made against the assessment.
The evaluation is reviewed again via an internal administrative procedure.
The examiner reviews the assessment for procedural errors.
The examiner reviews the assessment for deficiencies.
The objection is rejected if there are no errors or deficiencies.
The appeal procedure is subject to a fee.
The costs of the appeal procedure are based on time and effort.
Students have the right to take legal action before the administrative court.
Students have the right to comprehensive inspection.
Students have the right to copy for their own purposes.
The digitally conducted examination does not restrict student rights.
The digitally conducted inspection does not restrict student rights.
Details about student rights are available in the teaching area.
